definitions.definition: A temporary modification to a piece of equipment to change the way it operates (usually away from as originally designed).
definitions.example: I had to put a couple of frigs across the switch relays but it works now.
Will you sit down and stop frigging around.
She never forgot the day she was caught frigging herself in the library.

definitions.definition: To mess or muck (about, around etc.)
definitions.example: Be sensible, you’re just frigging about now.

definitions.definition: To make a temporary alteration to something, to fudge, to manipulate
definitions.example: The system wasn't working but I've frigged the data and it's usable now.
